                                                                   @NotNull java.nio.file.Path path)
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Evaluates whether or not a given Path reference directory exists. If it exists nothing is done. If it did not yet exist, the directory is created.

        public boolean move(java.nio.file.Path sourceFile,
                    java.nio.file.Path targetFile)
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Attempts to move a file to a target file. If the target file does not exist it will be created.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • read

        public <T> Exceptional<T> read(java.nio.file.Path file,
                               java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Get the content of a file, and map the given values to a generic type T. The exact file is completely dynamic, though it is usually encouraged to use FileManager.getDataFile(org.dockbox.hartshorn.api.domain.TypedOwner) or FileManager.getConfigFile(java.lang.Class<?>) to obtain appropriate files.
        Specified by:
        read in interface FileManager
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the type to map to
        Parameters:
        file - The file to read the content of
        type - The exact type to map to
        Returns:
        A Exceptional instance holding either the mapping T instance, or a Throwable

      • read

        public <T> Exceptional<T> read(java.nio.file.Path file,
                               GenericType<T> type)
        Specified by:
        read in interface FileManager

      • write

        public <T> Exceptional<java.lang.Boolean> write(java.nio.file.Path file,
                                                T content)
        Description copied from interface: FileManager
        Write a generic type T to a given file. The exact file is completely dynamic, though it is usually encouraged to use FileManager.getDataFile(org.dockbox.hartshorn.api.domain.TypedOwner) or FileManager.getConfigFile(java.lang.Class<?>) to obtain appropriate files.
        Specified by:
        write in interface FileManager
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type parameter of the content
        Parameters:
        file - The file to write the content of
        content - The content to write
        Returns:
        A Exceptional instance holding a Boolean indicating the success status of the write process, or a Throwable. If a Throwable is present, the Boolean value should be false.
